串.definition: to string together; to skewer; to connect wrongly; to gang up; to rove; string; bunch; skewer; classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of; to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus); to move across

串供.definition: to collude to fabricate a story

串味.definition: to become tainted with the smell of sth else; to pick up an odor

串崗.definition: to leave one's post while on duty

串戲.definition: to act in a play; (of an amateur) to play a part in a professional performance

串換.definition: to exchange; to change; to swap

串燒.definition: to cook on a skewer; barbecued food on a skewer; shish kebab; (fig.) to perform or play songs in sequence; sequence of songs; medley

串聯.definition: to establish ties; to contact; (electricity) to connect (components) in series

串親訪友.definition: to call on friends and relations (idiom)

串通.definition: to collude; to collaborate; to gang up

串鄉.definition: to go from village to village (like an itinerant artist)

串門.definition: to call on sb; to drop in; to visit sb's home

串門兒.definition: erhua variant of 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
